articles.description: This tuner is really compact so it leaves space for more pedals and it is always on.
The beatbuddy is a must for bassists I think to have backing drums for creating solo work. The SDrum is great for when you have a riff and don't know what drum would suit without a drummer.
I had the OC5 first and when I first started using it I think it was helping my ear with the octave. Then I got the POG. I interchange them.
I love the noises of this.
I should use these more, I was given the silver one by my old band and used it in les pantalons.
I like the noise of this one. Apparently Thin Lizzy used phasers so I like to think this helps my lizzy covers!
I only got this pedal this year and its a favourite!

I used to use this pedal a lot as I thought it was supposed to smooth the sound. I found it had a buzz and stopped using it. Apparently though compressors are important so I have started trying to use it again, it's hard to make room for it 0x1F602
I used to use a stagebug sb2 but I upgraded to this DI.
This pedal I have set up for drop half step tuning.
I'm not sure this was really a bass pedal but I love the sound and use it a lot.
I have this pedal on frequently lately as the overdrive for the envelope filter.

I think I noticed a difference when I first got this for the garage. Some people use acoustic foam panels, but I had done some reading and decided to get a bass trap. I have 2 as I ordered one and it went missing so I ordered another and the first showed up a good time later and the company allowed to keep it for free!
Thanks to all the pedal pushers this list is ever growing... Starting to think I should maybe just learn how to build my own.
